poem:
"Plums on the Morning of Political Discourse"

Morning spews news of sanguine dissent,
Senators rattle in the Capitol, hot as white, ripened plums.
Parliaments of words flirt with the fate of a bill,
While the old clock, our patient referee, ticks.
Humor and dread intermingled,
In this intricate dance of policy and filibuster,
Today, I eat my breakfast with politics.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fate of US Senate foreign aid bill uncertain in House - live 1.54pm GMT Fate of Senate foreign aid bill uncertain in House Good morning, and welcome to another day in US politics. Like most recent days in Washington and out on the campaign trail, this one promises to be filled with fun. (Depending on your definition of “fun”, natch.) To wit: Early this morning, after various rightwing, pro-Trump senators mounted an old-fashioned all-night talkathon,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
